content.name: April Yi Wang
content.affiliation:
University of Michigan
School of Information

meat.p:
I am a first-year Ph.D. student at the School of Information at the University of Michigan, advised by Professor Steve Oney and Professor Christopher Brooks. My broad research area is human-computer interaction (HCI), with a focus on enabling and encouraging collaborations for end-user programming. My recent project involves improving computational notebook infrastructure (e.g., support real-time group collaboration, facilitate joint discourse over shared context) to better support collaborative data science.

I received my B.Eng. in Computer Science from Zhejiang University and M.Sc. degree in Computer Science from Simon Fraser University, where my master thesis investigated non-programmers learning computational literacy.

p.news: Traveling to CHI19, Glasgow. I will attend the workshop on Human-Centered Study of Data Science Work Practices. I am also a student volunteer this year <3
Excited to start the new semester as a PhD student in Umich!
Our paper, "Mismatch of Expectations: How Modern Learning Resources Fail Conversational Programmers", received the honorable mention award on CHI 2018!
Presented our poster on conversational programmer at ICER'17, Tacoma WA
Our paper on Social Cheatsheet was accepted to CSCW2018!
Attended CRA Women Grad Cohort Workshop 2017, Washington DC

item.content: April Y. Wang, Ryan Mitts, Philip J. Guo and Parmit K. Chilana. 2018. Mismatch of Expectations: How Modern Learning Resources Fail Conversational Programmers. Proceedings of the ACM Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems (CHI18).

Laton Vermette, Shruti Dembla, April Y. Wang, Joanna McGrenere and Parmit K. Chilana. 2018. Social CheatSheet: An Interactive Community-Curated Information Overlay for Web Applications. Proceedings of the ACM : Human-Computer Interaction (1,1), Computer-Supported Cooperative Work and Social Computing (CSCW18).

April Y. Wang, Steve Oney and Christopher Brooks. 2019.

Redesigning Notebooks for Data Science Education.

Workshop on Human-Centered Study of Data Science Work Practices at ACM Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems (CHI19), Glasgow, UK, May 2019.

April Y. Wang and Parmit K. Chilana. 2017.

Investigating Learning Strategies of Conversational Programmers.

ACM Conference on International Computing Education Research (ICER17), Tacoma, WA, August 2017.
